segment.source: Learn about known issues for the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: Learn about known issues for the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Known issues for the Microsoft advertising libraries
segment.target: Known issues for the Microsoft advertising libraries

segment.source: Known issues for the Microsoft advertising libraries
segment.target: Known issues for the Microsoft advertising libraries

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: This topic lists the known issues with the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: This topic lists the known issues with the current release of the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Installation requires Visual Studio Tools for Universal Windows Apps
segment.target: Installation requires Visual Studio Tools for Universal Windows Apps

segment.source: To install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015, you must have version 1.1 or later of the Visual Studio Tools for Universal Windows Apps installed.
segment.target: To install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015, you must have version 1.1 or later of the Visual Studio Tools for Universal Windows Apps installed.

segment.source: For more information, see the Visual Studio release notes.
segment.target: For more information, see the Visual Studio release notes.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight projects
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight projects

segment.source: To get the Microsoft advertising assemblies for Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight projects, install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, open your project in Visual Studio, and then go to ProjectAdd Connected ServiceAd Mediator to automatically download the assemblies.
segment.target: To get the Microsoft advertising assemblies for Windows Phone 8.x Silverlight projects, install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK, open your project in Visual Studio, and then go to ProjectAdd Connected ServiceAd Mediator to automatically download the assemblies.

segment.source: After doing this, you can remove the ad mediator references from your project if you do not want to use ad mediation.
segment.target: After doing this, you can remove the ad mediator references from your project if you do not want to use ad mediation.

segment.source: For more information, see AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight.
segment.target: For more information, see AdControl in Windows Phone Silverlight.

segment.source: AdControl interface unknown in XAML
segment.target: AdControl interface unknown in XAML

segment.source: The XAML markup for an AdControl may incorrectly show a blue curvy line implying that the interface is unknown.
segment.target: The XAML markup for an AdControl may incorrectly show a blue curvy line implying that the interface is unknown.

segment.source: This occurs only when targeting x86, and it may be ignored.
segment.target: This occurs only when targeting x86, and it may be ignored.

segment.source: lastError from previous ad request
segment.target: lastError from previous ad request

segment.source: If there is a leftover lastError from the previous ad request, the event may be fired twice during the next ad call.
segment.target: If there is a leftover lastError from the previous ad request, the event may be fired twice during the next ad call.

segment.source: While the new ad request will still be made and may yield a valid ad, this behavior may cause confusion.
segment.target: While the new ad request will still be made and may yield a valid ad, this behavior may cause confusion.

segment.source: Interstitial ads and navigation buttons on phones
segment.target: Interstitial ads and navigation buttons on phones

segment.source: On phones (or emulators) that have software Back, Start, and Search buttons instead of hardware buttons, the countdown timer and click through buttons for video interstitial ads may be obscured.
segment.target: On phones (or emulators) that have software Back, Start, and Search buttons instead of hardware buttons, the countdown timer and click through buttons for video interstitial ads may be obscured.

segment.source: Recently created ads are not being served to your app
segment.target: Recently created ads are not being served to your app

segment.source: If you have created an ad recently (less than a day), it might not be available immediately.
segment.target: If you have created an ad recently (less than a day), it might not be available immediately.

segment.source: If the ad has been approved for editorial content, it will be served once the advertising server has processed it and the ad is available as inventory.
segment.target: If the ad has been approved for editorial content, it will be served once the advertising server has processed it and the ad is available as inventory.

segment.source: No ads are shown in your app
segment.target: No ads are shown in your app

segment.source: There are many reasons you may see no ads, including network errors.
segment.target: There are many reasons you may see no ads, including network errors.

segment.source: Other reasons might include:
segment.target: Other reasons might include:

segment.source: Selecting an ad unit in Windows Dev Center with a size that is greater or less than the size of the AdControl in your app's code.
segment.target: Selecting an ad unit in Windows Dev Center with a size that is greater or less than the size of the AdControl in your app's code.

segment.source: Ads will not appear if you're using a test mode value for your ad unit ID when running a live app.
segment.target: Ads will not appear if you're using a test mode value for your ad unit ID when running a live app.

segment.source: If you created a new ad unit ID in the past half-hour, you might not see an ad until the servers propagate new data through the system.
segment.target: If you created a new ad unit ID in the past half-hour, you might not see an ad until the servers propagate new data through the system.

segment.source: Existing IDs that have shown ads before should show ads immediately.
segment.target: Existing IDs that have shown ads before should show ads immediately.

segment.source: If you can see test ads in the app, your code is working and is able to display ads.
segment.target: If you can see test ads in the app, your code is working and is able to display ads.

segment.source: If you encounter issues, contact product support.
segment.target: If you encounter issues, contact product support.

segment.source: On that page, choose In-App Advertising.
segment.target: On that page, choose In-App Advertising.

segment.source: You can also post a question in the forum.
segment.target: You can also post a question in the forum.

segment.source: Test ads are showing in your app instead of live ads
segment.target: Test ads are showing in your app instead of live ads

segment.source: Test ads can be shown, even when you are expecting live ads.
segment.target: Test ads can be shown, even when you are expecting live ads.

segment.source: This can happen in the following scenarios:
segment.target: This can happen in the following scenarios:

segment.source: Microsoft advertising cannot verify or find the live application ID used in the app store.
segment.target: Microsoft advertising cannot verify or find the live application ID used in the app store.

segment.source: In this case, when an ad unit is created by a user, its status can start as live (non-test) but will move to test status within 6 hours after the first ad request.
segment.target: In this case, when an ad unit is created by a user, its status can start as live (non-test) but will move to test status within 6 hours after the first ad request.

segment.source: It will change back to live if there are no requests from test apps for 10 days.
segment.target: It will change back to live if there are no requests from test apps for 10 days.

segment.source: Side-loaded apps or apps that are running in the emulator will not show live ads.
segment.target: Side-loaded apps or apps that are running in the emulator will not show live ads.

segment.source: When a live ad unit is serving test ads, the ad unit’s status shows Active and serving test ads in Windows Dev Center.
segment.target: When a live ad unit is serving test ads, the ad unit’s status shows Active and serving test ads in Windows Dev Center.

segment.source: This does not currently apply to phone apps.
segment.target: This does not currently apply to phone apps.

segment.source: Obsolete test values for ad unit ID and application ID no longer working
segment.target: Obsolete test values for ad unit ID and application ID no longer working

segment.source: The following test values for Windows Phone Silverlight apps are obsolete, and will no longer work.
segment.target: The following test values for Windows Phone Silverlight apps are obsolete, and will no longer work.

segment.source: If you have an existing project that uses these test values, update your project to use the values provided in Test mode values.
segment.target: If you have an existing project that uses these test values, update your project to use the values provided in Test mode values.

segment.source: Application ID
segment.target: Application ID

segment.source: Ad unit ID
segment.target: Ad unit ID

segment.source: test_client
segment.target: test_client

segment.source: Image320_50
segment.target: Image320_50

segment.source: test_client
segment.target: test_client

segment.source: Image300_50
segment.target: Image300_50

segment.source: test_client
segment.target: test_client

segment.source: TextAd
segment.target: TextAd

segment.source: test_client
segment.target: test_client

segment.source: Image480_80
segment.target: Image480_80

segment.source: Reference errors caused by targeting Any CPU in your project
segment.target: Reference errors caused by targeting Any CPU in your project

segment.source: When using the Microsoft advertising libraries, you cannot target Any CPU in your project.
segment.target: When using the Microsoft advertising libraries, you cannot target Any CPU in your project.

segment.source: If your project targets the Any CPU platform, you may see a warning after adding the reference similar to this one.
segment.target: If your project targets the Any CPU platform, you may see a warning after adding the reference similar to this one.

segment.source: referenceerrorsolutionexplorer
segment.target: referenceerrorsolutionexplorer

segment.source: To remove this warning, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).
segment.target: To remove this warning, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).

segment.source: Use Configuration Manager to set the platform targets for debug and release configurations.
segment.target: Use Configuration Manager to set the platform targets for debug and release configurations.

segment.source: configurationmanagerwin10
segment.target: configurationmanagerwin10

segment.source: When you create your app packages for store submission (as shown in the following images), be sure to include the architectures you intend to target.
segment.target: When you create your app packages for store submission (as shown in the following images), be sure to include the architectures you intend to target.

segment.source: You may opt to skip x64 if you intend to run x86 builds on the x64 OS.
segment.target: You may opt to skip x64 if you intend to run x86 builds on the x64 OS.

segment.source: projectstorecreateapppackages
segment.target: projectstorecreateapppackages

segment.source: createapppackages
segment.target: createapppackages

segment.source: Z-order in JavaScript/HTML apps
segment.target: Z-order in JavaScript/HTML apps

segment.source: JavaScript/HTML apps must not place elements into the reserved MAX-10 range of z-order.
segment.target: JavaScript/HTML apps must not place elements into the reserved MAX-10 range of z-order.

segment.source: The sole exception is an interrupt overlay, such as an inbound call notification for a Skype app.
segment.target: The sole exception is an interrupt overlay, such as an inbound call notification for a Skype app.

segment.source: Do not use borders
segment.target: Do not use borders

segment.source: Setting border-related properties inherited by the AdControl from its parent class will cause the ad placement to be wrong.
segment.target: Setting border-related properties inherited by the AdControl from its parent class will cause the ad placement to be wrong.

segment.source: More Information
segment.target: More Information

segment.source: For more information about the latest known issues and to post questions related to the Microsoft advertising libraries, visit the forum.
segment.target: For more information about the latest known issues and to post questions related to the Microsoft advertising libraries, visit the forum.

segment.source: Support
segment.target: Support

segment.source: To contact product support for issues with the Microsoft advertising libraries, visit the support page and choose In-App Advertising.
segment.target: To contact product support for issues with the Microsoft advertising libraries, visit the support page and choose In-App Advertising.
